Title: Joseph Being Sold to the Vizier of Egypt on the Insistence of Zulaykha
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Description: This illustration from Walters manuscript W.808 depicts Joseph (Yusuf) being sold to the vizier of Egypt (al-'Aziz) on the insistence of Zulaykha.
CreditLine: Gift in honor of Sara D. Redmond by her family, 1985
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Iran; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Family of Sara D. Redmond [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1985, by gift.
Creator: Nur al-Din `Abd al-Rahman ibn Ahmad Jami (Persian, died 898 AH/AD 1492)
